Job Description:
LMA is delighted to partner with an established Cybersecurity company looking to appoint a dynamic and results-driven Cybersecurity Scientist to join their Singapore branch.
This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated professional to play a pivotal role in the growth and success of their business.

Job Description:

We seek a highly skilled and experienced lead cybersecurity scientist to guide our cybersecurity product strategy and research initiatives and ensure the security of our company’s products and infrastructure. This senior leadership role requires a deep understanding of the cybersecurity industry, hands-on experience in technical research, and the ability to drive innovation in security products.
Key Responsibilities:

Cybersecurity Product Strategy:
Collaborate with Product Teams to craft the company’s cybersecurity product strategy and roadmap.
Continuously assess and adapt the product strategy to address new and evolving cybersecurity challenges.
Cybersecurity Research:
Lead Cybersecurity Engineers in conducting technical research to understand and forecast emerging cyber threats.
Develop and evaluate approaches to effectively address these threats.
Monitor global cybersecurity trends and integrate relevant findings into the product strategy and roadmap
Conduct internal product validations to ensure that our cybersecurity products are world-class.
Company Security:
Oversee the security of the company’s products and infrastructure, ensuring compliance with industry standards and best practices.
Manage and maintain company security certifications such as ISO27001 and CSA STAR Level 2

Job Requirements:
Minimum 6 years of technical experience in cybersecurity, with a strong emphasis on research in industry.
Proven experience in using and managing a wide range of cybersecurity products, cybersecurity researchers, cybersecurity analysts or software engineers.
Technical experience in one or more of these areas: zero-day vulnerability research, incident response, forensics, reverse engineering exploits, manual penetration testing etc
Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing cybersecurity landscapes and incorporate new information into strategic planning.

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Backend Development:
Design, develop, and maintain microservices architecture using .NET Core and .NET 8.
Implement event-driven architecture to enable seamless communication between microservices.
Utilize Entity Framework (EF) for efficient database interactions and management.
Containerize applications using Docker for scalability and deployment flexibility.
Apply Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles to ensure clean and modular code architecture.
Implement OAuth for secure authentication and authorization.
Develop and enforce security best practices to safeguard sensitive data and systems.
Utilize AWS services such as S3, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, etc., for backend development.
Develop RESTful APIs endpoints to facilitate communication between the frontend and backend.
Frontend Development:
Develop responsive and user-friendly web applications using React.js and Next.js.
Write unit tests using Jest to ensure code quality and reliability.
Create reusable UI components and maintain a consistent design using Storybook.
Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers to implement intuitive and visually appealing interfaces.
Troubleshoot and debug issues across the stack, ensuring smooth application operation.
Optimize application performance and scalability for a seamless user experience.
What we are looking for:
Proven experience as a Full Stack .NET Core Developer or similar role.
Strong proficiency in .NET Core, .NET 8, C#, and related backend technologies.
Experience building microservices architecture and implementing event-driven design patterns.
Proficiency in Entity Framework (EF) for database management.
Familiarity with Docker and containerization principles.
Knowledge of Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles and their application in backend development.
Experience implementing OAuth for authentication and authorization.
Understanding of security best practices and their application in backend development.
Hands-on experience with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, etc.
Proficiency in frontend technologies such as React.js, Next.js, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience writing unit tests using Jest and maintaining a design system with Storybook.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Preferably more than 5 years of experience as a full stack developer;
Experience working in both Unix and Windows operating environments are preferred.
AWS certification (e.g., AWS Certified Developer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect).
Experience with Node.js for server-side development.
Familiarity with NoSQL databases such as DynamoDB.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Understanding of Agile development methodologies.
skills: ['CSS', 'Scalability', '.NET', 'Design Patterns', 'HTML', 'User Experience', 'JavaScript', 'Unix', 'UI', 'Windows', 'Docker', 'Web Applications', 'C#', 'API', 'Databases', 'Agile Development']

Job Title: Senior Consultant  Sap Production Planning  Sg
Job Description:
Senior Consultant - SAP Production Planning – SG

Are you ready to unleash your potential?
At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.
We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.
Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.
We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.
Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!
Work you will do
This role sits within the SAP team of Deloitte Southeast Asia, which encompasses the SAP Module solutions respectively. As a leader of this group, you will drive the growth of our SAP business in the region and be responsible for the creation, sale and delivery of SAP solutions: Functional and Technical Design, SAP Application & Systems Development, SAP Business Transformation, etc.
Engage clients in workshops and interviews to analyze process and reporting requirements
Advise clients on industry/ cross-industry leading practices. Advise clients on SAP recommended processes and functions
Design target state SAP solutions for clients. Influence clients’ thinking in adopting leading/ standard practices while developing target state
Design and develop comprehensive business models within SAP SAC
Analyze application landscape to design interfaces to SAP solution
Perform SAP configuration and tests.
Lead the consultant and client teams through the implementation cycle including planning and execution of testing, migration and cutover.
Support change management execution by developing training material, delivering training and supporting users post cutover.
Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders
What we are looking for
If you are someone with:
A good honors Degree, preferably at postgraduate level, in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, Business, Engineering, Mathematics or related disciplines.
Senior Consultant will require a minimum of 6 years of experience in SAP Production Planning Module, completed at least an end to end full life cycle of SAP Production Planning. Also have some team leading experiences would be a plus
Demonstrated success in multi-cultural work environment.
Sound understanding of business process, industry nuances and leading practices in area of focus
Ability to facilitate effective workshops to lead target state design.
Ability to lead teams
Demonstrated excellence in conceiving and executing SAP solution
Broad understanding of SAP design. Appreciation of digital enterprise and emerging technologies
Sound business acumen, teamwork and leadership qualities.
Willingness to work outside of office base and most of all…
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.
Due to volume of applications, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.

Job Description:
As an Industry Analyst specializing in IT Security, you will be responsible for researching and analyzing industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscapes within the IT security and services sector. Your insights will inform product development, strategic planning, and client engagement. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our solutions meet market demands and address emerging threats.

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Market Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on IT security trends, technologies, and market developments. Analyze data to identify emerging threats, opportunities, and competitive intelligence.
Reporting and Documentation: Develop detailed reports, whitepapers, and presentations on industry trends, market forecasts, and competitive analysis. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with product management and development teams to align our security solutions with market needs. Support the development of strategic roadmaps and product/service go to market.
Client Engagement: Act as a subject matter expert for clients, offering insights on industry trends, threat landscapes, and best practices. Assist in the development of client-facing materials and presentations.
Competitive Analysis: Monitor and evaluate competitor activities, product offerings, and market positioning. Identify gaps and opportunities for differentiation.
Thought Leadership: Contribute to thought leadership initiatives, including blog posts, webinars, and industry conferences. Represent [Your Company Name] as an expert in IT security.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, and analyst teams to ensure alignment on market needs and product strategy.
Author research, advisory and content marketing documents
Perform MarketScape reports (vendor comparisons)
Engage the client/prospect once a week
Support all CIS renewals in the quarter
Support business development for any consulting/CIS
Speak at client events, industry events and facilitate round tables/panel discussions
Perform advisory to senior leadership teams from security vendors/services providers
Support planning and P&L activities

Requirements:
The candidate must have a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant work experience in the IT/technology industry, IT/digital functional areas, or business/strategy/technology consulting, or in leading market research firms.
Has excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Delivering presentations to external clients.
Is well-connected in the technology industry.
Able to connect well with directors/VP executives across APAC region.
Has worked in a multi-cultural environment.
Able to work independently and collaboratively.
Able to work with tight timelines and multi-task/manage projects.
Able to adapt quickly to changing market dynamics and client expectations.
A positive attitude and willingness to learn and share.
Able to function in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description:
Our client is a well-established multinational corporation, serving as a one-stop communication provider in Southeast Asia. They offer comprehensive solutions and services to meet diverse business needs in the region.
They are seeking are seeking an experienced Channel Alliance Manager to drive business expansion across the APAC region through strategic technology alliances and distributors.
In this role, you will collaborate with sales, presales, marketing, and partner teams to promote IT System Integration products and solutions. Your primary focus will be on fostering strong partnerships with key technology providers and developing joint go-to-market campaigns that drive sales growth.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage and grow relationships with strategic technology partners (e.g., Cisco, Fortinet, CrowdStrike).
Collaborate with the Partner Program Team to create and execute partner campaigns.
Drive business success by working closely with sales, presales, and marketing teams.
Develop and implement business plans with strategic technology alliances.
Build executive-level relationships with key partners.
Create and execute enablement training programs for sales and presales teams.
Generate demand and accelerate sales opportunities to closure.
Attend industry events, trade shows, and partner meetings to drive business growth.
Requirements:
Proven experience in selling IT System Integration products and solutions.
Strong understanding of IT market trends and technology (experience with Cisco, Fortinet, or CrowdStrike preferred).
Regional experience in the APAC market, with knowledge of local business landscapes and distributors.
Business development experience, especially in managing partner programs and strategic alliances.
Strong collaboration and relationship-building skills.
Willingness to travel as needed.
This role offers a fantastic opportunity to lead strategic initiatives in a dynamic and growing market. If you have a strong track record of success in IT sales and channel partnerships, we want to hear from you!
To apply, please send your latest resume, in word format outlining your relevant experience and qualifications to ong.irene@platformnco.com. We look forward hearing from you.

Please note that unfortunately, at this moment, our client is unable to extend support to candidates under the EP, SP, or WP schemes. Thank you for your understanding.

Job Title: Content Solutions And Sponsorship Lead Large Customer Sales  Singapore
Job Description:
Product area
Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.
Job description
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Additional job description
As the Content Solutions & Sponsorship lead, you are the link between YouTube and Sales. Your role is to turn product innovations into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of Google’s advertising products. You will partner with Sales team members in building the strongest commercial strategy, and we equip customer-facing Googlers with essential product expertise. You will work on maximizing the YouTube Music opportunity, working on Festive Tent pole Moments, collaborating on scaled content innovations such as Roadblocks & Line Ups.
Qualifications
Job responsibilities
Partner with Video Specialists and Sales teams to establish strategy and grow Content Revenue (YouTube Select) at the local market level.
Lead awareness and training of the Content Proposition, ensure Sales excellence and reporting against lead lists.
Be the local Subject Matter Expert, identify Tentpole Content moments, develop narratives and lend pitch support for the top leads.
Support execution of Content Solution projects, introduce implementations tools and influence Product teams for long term impact.
Drive cross functional collaborations in local market (with local market stakeholders, YouTube Partnerships, Marketing, gTech and Media Planners) unlocking local Content Solutions opportunities for brands.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in digital media, sales, marketing, or product roles.
Experience working with digital organizations.
Experience identifying and recommending ways to improve product and customer strategy.
Experience working within the South East Asia markets.
Preferred qualifications
Experience and understanding of the wider media world, including communications planning, content strategy, publishing and media owner.
Experience developing and executing large sponsorship programs.
Understanding of the YouTube ecosystem (viewers, creators, advertisers) and products.
Demonstrated consulting skills, with the ability to successfully influence stakeholders at all levels.
Knowledge of the Content and Creator landscape.

Description of the Company’s background
Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong
Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018. Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart
manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT
platform at its core.

Embracing our vision of “Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users’
hearts”, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and
operational eïciency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices
to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.
Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The company’s market share in
terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021. The
company has also established the world’s leading consumer AIoT (AI+IoT) platform, with
374.5 million smart devices connected to its platform (excluding smartphones and laptops)
as of 31 March 31, 2021, excluding smartphones and laptops. Xiaomi products are present
in more than 100 countries and regions around the world.

Job Description:
Job Summary
You will be working with our client in the financial industry. As a Project Manager for Cloud Migration, you will lead the end-to-end migration of on-premises infrastructure and applications from on-prem to AWS Cloud. You will work closely with solution architects, cross-functional teams, including IT, business stakeholders, and cloud architects, to ensure successful planning, execution, and delivery of cloud migration projects. Your role will involve managing timelines, budgets, resources, and risks, ensuring that projects meet business objectives and comply with security and regulatory requirements.
Responsibilities
Plan, coordinate, and manage cloud migration projects from on-premises to AWS, ensuring that project objectives, timelines, and budgets are met.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables in alignment with business requirements.
Work closely with solution architects, cloud architects, infrastructure teams, and vendors to execute the migration strategy.
Identify and mitigate risks and issues throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
Manage the development and execution of migration roadmaps, including application, database, and data migration.
Lead project teams in the identification of dependencies, bottlenecks, and resource needs to ensure timely delivery.
Ensure compliance with AWS cloud security standards, policies, and best practices.
Communicate project status, risks, and mitigation plans to senior management and stakeholders.
Monitor post-migration performance and ensure operational stability and optimization of AWS cloud infrastructure.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 8 years of experience in managing IT projects, preferably experience in GCC migration.
Strong knowledge of AWS cloud services, including EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM, and security best practices.
Experience in managing large-scale infrastructure migration projects, particularly from on-premises to cloud environments.
Proven track record in managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders and dependencies.
Strong understanding of Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies.
Experience with cloud automation tools, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation) is a plus.
Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified Developer) will be an added advantage.
If you are interested in this role and would like to discuss the opportunity further please click apply now or email Chew Kai-Xinn at kaixinnchew@morganmckinley.com for more information.

Job Title: Country Manager  Head Of North Asia Sales
Job Description:
Who we are:
For over 50 years, we have worked closely with investment and asset managers to become the world's leading provider of integrated investment management solutions. We are 2500+ employees, 80 nationalities with a broad range of nationalities, educations, professional experiences, ages, and backgrounds in general.

SimCorp is an independent subsidiary of the Deutsche Börse Group. Following the recent merger with Axioma, we leverage the combined strength of our brands to provide an industry-leading, full, front-to-back offering for our clients, with SimCorp as the overarching company brand and Axioma as a key product brand.

SimCorp is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture where diverse perspectives and expertise are integrated in our everyday work. We believe in the continual growth and development of our employees, so that we can provide best-in-class solutions to our clients.

While striving to deliver client value, we believe it is vital to consider our people and our planet in every business decision we make. Acting responsibly is not optional. It is essential.

Why is the role important to us:
SimCorp APAC is looking for a proven, results-driven and solution-oriented Country Manager/Head of Sales who will be accountable and fully responsible for the ‘functional sell’ of SimCorp product and services offers, to new SimCorp APAC clients. This will include having responsibility for the leadership, direction, and mentorship of the sales team and presales team on specific deals as well as working closely with the marketing function in region.

The role requires a broad understanding of various financial markets, ranging from trading, analytics, settlement, to performance measurement, risk management, fund administration and accounting. Due to the broad asset class coverage in SimCorp Dimension, there will be exposure to everything from straight forward equities and fixed income securities to more complex derivate, credit and OTC instruments.

What you will be responsible for
The Country Manager/Head of Sales is assigned a given territory / industry segment or Portfolio of prospective clients within a Market Unit and he/she is primarily responsible for planning, qualifying, executing and driving winning sales campaigns. The Country Manager/Head of Sales works closely with PreSales, Services and other internal stakeholders to achieve new business sales targets through license sales and enabling service sales. The Country Manager/Head of Sales becomes the trusted advisor of the prospective client’s decision-making body where he/she is able to differentiate SimCorp’s offerings by teaching the prospective clients something new about their business that will lead to SimCorp’s unique benefits.

Your accountabilities include but will not be limited to:
Achievement of new and additional license revenue targets across Asia
Territory development ensuring all opportunities are qualified, developed and managed effectively through to closure of a sale
Research, analyse and confirm addressable market in Asia
Proactively support sales and marketing campaigns as defined by the global and regional marketing functions.
Maintain and update accurate information in Salesforce
Engage, along with the sales team, with the client and develop initial relationships to discover the opportunity. Partner with Marketing and enable Inside Sales to discover opportunities to drive pipeline creation.
Create and implement strategic and operational plans to improve the market position, product range, innovation sales support, brand awareness and customer focus to attract volume from competitors.
Articulate the need internally at SimCorp APAC. Understand the opportunity.
Identify that it is real. Qualify the opportunity.
Determine likelihood of a win. Assess the qualified opportunity.
Create pursuit team – including with the collaboration of senior locally and globally. Win the opportunity.
Ensure detailed information transfer from the sales process to the implementation team after a contract has been signed.
Be knowledgeable about different areas in SimCorp offers and become an expert in the value propositions of our solutions.
Be an active part of negotiating contract pricing and overall responsibility for legal matters.
Lead, coach, motivate and develop the team to deliver effective and robust marketing strategies that leverage the core values and create strong competitive advantage.
Explore new routes to market – identifying and exploiting new technologies, services and partnerships to maximise revenue opportunities.
Identifying and prioritising key players and top targets and corresponding opportunities of growth in line with broader SimCorp product growth objectives.
What we value
Above all, your ability to thrive in and contribute to this role is paramount. Your skills' origins are less critical; however, we expect proficiency in several of the following areas, with an eagerness to learn:
A relevant Bachelor’s degree, advanced degrees preferred, and a demonstrated interest and ability to engage in solutions- oriented discussion with senior leaders of the fund industry
Previous experience in a Sales role is critical.
Previous enterprise sales experience with hands-on experience producing quality output in a fast-paced organization managing multiple priorities.
Ability to develop and maintain relationships with the senior most leaders of the funds that are based in APAC – mutual funds, pension funds, insurance funds – for accounts in your addressable market.
Ability to learn/gain a deep understanding of the different business issues the SimCorp offerings solve – industry acumen and subject matter comfort, if not expertise, is a must.
Ability to think both strategically and tactically. The ability to work with and lead a sales process; choosing the best strategies for the organization and then successfully implementing the sales tactics through and with the deal team in order to achieve those strategies.
Balance of people, selling and relationship development skills, along with enough understanding of the core product solution and other services the company offers in order to differentiate SimCorp in the market and compel prospects towards interest and ongoing participation/revenue generation.
Demonstrated experience actively leading the lifecycle of the sales process including accurately updating sales forecast, managing salesforce.com and facilitating the weekly sales meeting to promote collaboration, accountability and progress.
Excellent customer relations and relationship management skills with the ability to focus on and understand customer requirements within the context of SimCorp's highly scalable solution.
Ability to identify market trends that may have an impact on corporate sales techniques.
The successful candidate will possess the following understandings and attributes:
Decision maker – be a strong team player but be capable of being decisive when needed
Persuasive, Assertive; confidence selling their knowledge/understanding and the product
Detailed Oriented; ability to make strategic decisions but also drive discussions with a focus on intricate sales metrics
Flexible and Collaborative
Able to deal with pressure
High integrity to whom a commitment is a promise and not just a suggestion
Reliable and accountable
Exceptional communication (written/oral) skills
Team Player - someone who can earn the trust of colleagues in senior management and employees at all levels of the organization and someone who can place their trust in the same
Benefits:
In addition to the traditional benefit scheme, we provide a good work & life balance and opportunities for professional development: there is never just only one route - we offer an individual approach to professional development to support the direction you want to take. Visit our career pages to learn more about working at SimCorp: www.simcorp.com/career
Since SimCorp operates in 20+ offices worldwide, the benefits package may vary from country to country.

Next Steps
Please click below to apply and to learn more about the vacancy and what SimCorp offers regarding salary, benefits, and perks.

Please note only applications sent through our system will be processed. Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your CV in English as soon as possible. If you are interested in being a part of SimCorp but are not sure this role is the right fit, submit your CV anyway. SimCorp is on an exciting growth journey, and our Talent Acquisition Team is ready to help you discover the right role for you. The approximate time to consider your CV is three weeks.

We are eager to continually improve our talent acquisition process and make everyone’s experience positive and valuable. Therefore, during the process we will ask you to provide your feedback, which is highly appreciated.

By Joining our team, you will have the chance to:
Become part of a thriving company comprising collaborative, curious, courageous, and capable employees
Explore a multitude of exciting learning and development opportunities, supported by our unique learning guild
Engage with highly skilled and supportive colleagues, each bringing their diverse backgrounds and perspectives
Join a company that not only values but actively advocates for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, fostering a truly inclusive and empowering environment

Job Description:
COMPANY's BRIEF INTRODUCTION
NYK Business Systems South Asia Pte Ltd (NBSSA) is the Information and Technology company based in Singapore as the regional headquarter, covering South East Asia/North Asia/West Asia countries. Our vast digital & technology systems comprise of different segments such as the technology solutions, infrastructure, applications and security divisions that provide dynamic support to our client and stakeholders.
JOB OUTLINE
We are currently recruiting for a Deputy General Manager of IT Application development and DX solution promotion to join us. The candidate must be an enthusiastic, proactive and motivated individual with real passion for technology. You are required to manage and work closely with the application Team and DX project Team and our customers in the Asia region to ensure the successful delivery of our services.
Candidate is responsible to ensure that the project management and service delivery to customers are in compliance with NYK Group Credo and business policies. He/she reports to the General Manager and to lead the division. He/she must ensure timely and accurate response to customer’s request, to liaise with each stakeholder (internal/external) to ensure smooth coordination for all transactions including pre-sales, contractual work, project P/L, and resource allocation.
Title: IT Deputy General Manager
Position level: Deputy General Manager
Role: Permanent
Working days: Mondays to Fridays
Working hours: 9:00am to 5.30pm
Qualifications: Diploma / Degree
Salary: SGD$ 7,000 to SGD$ 14,000 depending on experience
Job duty office add: 1 HarbourFront Place, #14-01 HarbourFront Tower One, Singapore 098633
Must be able to travel to subsidiary offices in Singapore and in various Asian countries including head office in Japan.

Your duties essential for the job:
· Develop high-level road map and project plans that merge customer requirements with company goals, so that staff can elaborate the detail action plans
· To work and coordinate with managers, technical personnel and external parties during all project phases, from initial development through implementation
· To keep track and monitor project progression and make detailed scheduled reports on measurable items such as milestones and deliverables
· Able to communicate proactively with all concerned parties to provide encouragement, identify problems, create solutions and implement efficient improvements.
· Analyze economics of project plans and provide actionable feedback relating to cost benefit and Return-on-Investment standards
· Review proposed modifications on project plans, including meeting with interested parties to approve and implement beneficial changes
· Oversee acquisition of resources and materials as needed before and during projects by talking to customers, team members, managers, and in-house accountants, and negotiating price and payment agreements with vendors
· Capable to anticipate future projects by communicating directly with customers, and staying updated on relevant trends and industry news
· To provide consultancy services by analyzing customer requirements and providing quality and cost-effective solutions to produce high quality bid proposal to customers
· To work closely with accounting team to ensure accurate and efficient monthly billing for timely update to BS/PL
· Fluent communication skills in both English and Japanese to engage with key stakeholders.
· Ability to interact with customers to identify and analyze their business process challenges and offer practical solutions.

Basic requirements:
· Over 12 years in the IT sector, with proven leadership in team management and successful project delivery.
· Strong project management and leadership skills, including the ability to lead teams and manage projects effectively.
· Excellent written and verbal communication, capable of explaining technical issues and collaborating with team members and management.
· Strong analytical skills for troubleshooting and resolving issues during project execution.
· Effective organization, time management, resource planning, and scheduling to keep projects on track.
· Broad knowledge of IT systems, applications, and technologies, with proficiency in Microsoft platforms and web-related tools.
· Experience or knowledge in the shipping and logistics industries is advantageous.
· Possess a minimum JPLT N1 cert in Japanese language to be able to report (both verbally and in writing) on project situation to the stakeholders or make presentation to existing/potential customers.
· Strong ability to learn new technologies and processes, stay current with technical skills, and adapt to changes.
· Must be a team player with the ability to multi-task, manage time effectively, and work well under pressure with a positive attitude.

Why join NYK Group?
Work, life balance.
Engaging workplace environment.
Opportunities for enhanced learning.
Competitive salary package and good benefits.
Yearly performance & variable bonus.

Liaise with various parties for coordinating system setup and overseeing entire onboarding process running smoothly
Running client testing internally and externally before promoting system/client changes to production environment
Review priorities and maps Client Enablement capacity on a regular basis to partner with business for client onboarding asks/tweaks/projects

Masters’ or Bachelors’ degree in Information Technology, Engineering or Science discipline.

The successful candidate should be able to coordinate work in addition to client onboarding related planning. Well organized communicating with various teams/stakeholders and be adaptive and be flexible in coming up solutions with a good mindset of risk management and being a result-oriented partner.

Job Description:
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The field service technician is a hands-on team player who will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient deployment, operation, maintenance, and repair of our HyperCube systems at multiple sites. The ideal candidate will be responsible for keeping our site operations running smoothly through providing high quality technical support, troubleshooting issues, and maintaining a strong customer relationship while adhering to safety and quality standards. This role requires on-site support and a willingness to tackle various tasks, including maintenance, repair, and manual labour.
Equipment Maintenance
Perform routine inspections, maintenance, installation and repairs on a range of mechanical, electrical, computing and ancillary systems associated with our data centre deployments, thus ensuring optimal functionality and longevity.
Troubleshooting
Diagnose and resolve technical issues, utilising problem-solving skills to identify root causes and implement effective solutions.
Deployment
Assist with computer modification works under direction of the site manager.
Assist to fill/drain the HyperCube with fluid under the direction of the infrastructure team.
Install/remove load banks as part of the commissioning process.
Assist to install computers as required.
Assist with installation of network cables into installed compute base.
Assist with commissioning and site teams as required.
Operations
Initial onsite fault response (electrical staff only)
Reset circuit breaker/replace fuse etc.
Reset pump/alarm/fault find under direction of SMEs.
Remove faulty computers from tank. Repair if within skillset and/or return to workshop.
Basic fault finding on Compute and Network under the direction of SMEs.
Site Management – empty HyperCool waste bins, clean up after site works, general maintenance and cleaning of SMC space.
OHS – undertake inspections as required and update first aid kits and eyewash stations, ensure PPE is available onsite.
Daily, weekly, monthly maintenance and inspections as required.
Escort visitors/other contractors on our sites and issue permits under the direction of our Global Operations Centre.
Assist with any tasks such as delivery of equipment to site, collection of equipment from stores etc.
Stakeholder Management
Provide excellent service to our Project and Operations teams through prompt response and effective communications.
Documentation
Maintain accurate records of service calls, repairs, and equipment maintenance, ensuring all paperwork and documentation are completed accurately and submitted on time.
Safety Compliance
Adhere to safety protocols, guidelines, and regulations to ensure a safe working environment for both yourself and customers.
Training
Stay up-to-date with product knowledge and industry trends through ongoing training and development.
Equipment Testing
Conduct performance testing and quality checks on equipment after repairs or maintenance to ensure they meet specifications.
Inventory Management
Maintain an inventory of necessary spare parts, tools, and equipment required for field service assignments.
Travel
Travel to our sites as needed, ensuring timely response to service requests.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Diploma or equivalent; technical certification; trade qualification.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in a similar role, including hands-on experience with equipment maintenance and repair.
Good problem-solving and communication skills. Proven to be able to work effectively under direction.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to be on stand-by, including evenings and weekends, as this position will be supporting 24/7 operations.
Hold a driver’s license to transport essential equipments. Holding a Class 4 license is a plus.

Job Description:
Responsibilities
Participate in JAD (Joint Application Design), RAD (Rapid Application Development) and DSD (Design Specifications Document) sessions to define and understand the business requirements and present detailed systems design documentation for reports, data interface files, data conversion and any other method of data exchange.
Develop, test, manage and implement SSIS Packages from development server to production server using package configuration.
Work on maintenance and Administration of SSIS by creating Jobs, Alerts, SQL Mail Agent, and schedule DTS/SSIS Packages.
Ability to automate the execution of SSIS packages using SQL Server Agent Jobs.
Ability to build complex queries and reports using Microsoft SQL.
Diagnose and resolve incident tickets and errors.
Develop ETL specifications, data mapping and other documentation required for ETL development.
Use SQL, data models, data element dictionary and schema to perform data and business analysis.
Understand business data and perform quality assurance testing to ensure the data presented is correct.
Ability to establish and maintain positive and effective work relationships with coworkers, clients, members, providers and customers.
Support Unit Testing, System Integration Testing, End-to-End System Testing, and User Acceptance Testing.
Design and guide other developers on complicated interfaces and should have strong debugging skills.

Job Description:
Software Engineer (Java)

Working Location: Central
Working Hours: Office working hours / Hybrid working arrangement
Salary Package: Up to $7,200 + AWS + Variable Bonus

Are you a talented Java developer eager to tackle complex business applications and system integrations? Join our dynamic team where you’ll play a crucial role in developing, testing, and maintaining essential software solutions. We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is committed to best practices throughout the software development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:
Software Development: Design, develop, test, and maintain business applications and systems integrations critical for operational success.
Lifecycle Management: Apply best practices in all phases of the software development process to deliver high-quality solutions.
Collaborative Planning: Work alongside software engineers, business analysts, and architects to crea1te robust and scalable applications.
Code Review: Participate in peer-reviews to ensure quality and effectiveness in solution designs and code.
Deployment & Support: Deploy systems to production environments and provide ongoing post-implementation support, addressing any issues that arise.
Troubleshooting: Analyze and resolve technical problems, and provide maintenance support by investigating and fixing issues as needed.
System Optimization: Understand and enhance the inter-dependencies between applications, systems, and databases to boost overall efficiency.
What We’re Looking For:
Java Expertise: Strong proficiency in Java and related technologies.
Web Skills: Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Ajax.
Framework Familiarity: Knowledge of Spring Framework, including its security, MVC, and cloud integration components.
API Understanding: Experience with RESTful APIs and SOAP/Web Services.
Database Skills: Proficiency in SQL and databases such as Oracle, MySQL, and PL/SQL.
Messaging Systems: Exposure to messaging technologies like RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, or JMS is advantageous.
Testing Experience: Familiarity with unit testing tools, such as JUnit and Spring Test.
Version Control & CI/CD: Proficiency with Git and CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Jira.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud solutions and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Database Proficiency: Advanced skills in MySQL.
Containerization: Knowledge of Kubernetes.
Big Data Technologies: Familiarity with Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, or Elasticsearch.
Front-End Development: Experience with Bootstrap and ReactJS.
If you’re passionate about Java development and looking to make an impact in a supportive and innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Product Development: Lead the complete product lifecycle from concept to launch, ensuring offerings are competitive and exceed market expectations.
Market Insight & Innovation: Gain a deep understanding of the needs of Requesting Licensees (RLs) and End Users (EUs), identifying gaps and creating innovative solutions to distinguish our offerings in the market.
Cross-Functional Leadership: Work collaboratively with teams from Business Development, Regulatory, Planning, Operations, IT, and Finance to ensure smooth product delivery and support.
Regulatory Engagement: Actively participate in regulatory discussions, providing insights to manage ongoing and ad-hoc regulatory issues that may affect product offerings or processes.
Financial & Capacity Management: Manage product budgets, forecast revenue, and optimize capacity planning to ensure availability, accessibility, and affordability.
Performance Monitoring & Optimization: Track product performance, implement corrective actions as needed, and continuously refine features, pricing, and business processes to maintain a competitive edge.
Customer-Centric Customization: Directly engage with customers to understand their unique needs, offering customized solutions that boost satisfaction and loyalty.
Compliance & Quality Assurance: Ensure all products and processes meet the necessary regulatory standards.
Requirements:
Degree in Business, Engineering, IT, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in Product Management within a telecommunications or IT environment (candidates with more than 5 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Product Manager role).
Proven experience with financial modeling and developing business cases.
Strong customer-focused mindset, with the ability to translate complex needs into strategic solutions.
Exceptional multitasking skills and the ability to manage KPIs, ensuring high-quality outcomes.
Demonstrated leadership, team-building, and critical thinking skills.

Job Description:
Who Are We Looking For

We're looking for someone to provide game changing services to our customers. Resourceful, independent and strong follow up skills are key qualities in this position.
You will be interacting with customers, responding to their needs. Gather customer’s information and determine the issue by evaluating and analysing the symptoms. You will follow up and make scheduled callbacks to customers where necessary. You will help build, maintain and troubleshoot the client's infrastructure. You will be working alongside other engineers to ensure highest levels of client service delivery.

Your Duties & Responsibilities

● Provide Level 1 / 2 IT support to end users (onsite / remotely)
● Provide front-line IT support to employees via walk-ups, tickets, and MS Teams
● Maintain accurate ticketing processes and asset management tracking records
● Provide emergency requests / VVIP support outside of business hours
● Monitor, troubleshoot, and repair IT hardware and software
● Handle hardware and software sourcing / purchasing
● Write and update technical documentation for end users and the IT team
● Assist in Projects / Audits based task given by the IT team
● Liaising with 3rd party vendors

You're Good At

● Good interpersonal skills
● Highly adaptable and flexible
● High level of ethics, values, integrity and trust
● High proficiency in both written and spoken English

Will Be Awesome If You Are/Have

● Highly disciplined and productive when working independently
● Takes initiative to identify gaps and develop solutions to close the gaps
● Good in follow up and follow through to complete tasks
● Powershell / CMD Line Scripting
● Deployment Knowledge (SCCM/Intune/Custom Imagings/Software Centers)
● Windows Server Knowledge

Qualifications

● Minimum 2 years of experience providing IT support in a corporate environment
● Experience in supporting and troubleshooting Windows 10, MS Office, Windows Server (ADFS/LDAP/WSUS) in a business environment

Job Description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture
Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently
Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:
5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep
Application:
Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:
1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection
skills: ['Designer', 'iOS', 'CSS', 'PHP', 'HTML', 'JavaScript', 'Mobile Applications', 'Web Developer', 'Team Player', 'Web Development']

Job Description:
Our Client:

Global company focusing on telecommunications, automotive, energy, and medical sectors. It produces essential products like optical fibers, power cables, and wiring harnesses, supporting high-speed communication, energy transmission, and modern vehicle systems. The company also manufactures medical devices and diagnostic equipment, contributing to healthcare advancements.

Responsibilities:
Ensure the seamless operation of day-to-day activities within our group companies, this is a regional role that covers Singapore, other Southeast Asia countries and greater China region
Support the implementation of initiatives that align with headquarters' strategic direction.
Uphold IT governance and ensure compliance with IT policies.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to applications, software, and network systems.
Plan, design, and implement application systems and IT infrastructure.
Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science or a related IT field.
2-3 years of relevant experience in a similar role or organization.
Chinese-speaker to support end users in other Asia region including China, Hong Kong and Taiwan
Knowledge of WAN, LAN, and wireless networking.
Proficiency in troubleshooting and resolving issues with applications, software, and hardware.
Familiarity with general operating systems, office software, and applications.
Understanding of database and network security systems.
Strong knowledge of computer hardware systems.
Good understanding of electronic information security.
Experience with J-SOX or a similar framework is an advantage.
Excellent communication skills.
A team player with the ability to work independently.

Apply online or feel free to contact me directly (via email: tingyee.lim@jac-recruitment.com) for more information about this opportunity. Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Lim Ting Yee (R23116601)
JAC Recruitment Pte. Ltd. (90C3026)

Job Description:
As a Network Security Engineer, you will provide Level 1/2 centralized technical support (Network & Cyber).

Job Description:

•⁠ ⁠Participate in maintenance standby duty to cover 24x7 support on rotational basis as pre-assigned by the team lead.
•⁠ ⁠Ensure SLA Level is achieved for every fault case.
•⁠ ⁠Ensure escalation is carried out when a fault call is beyond the knowledge of L1.
•⁠ ⁠Attend to daily call assignments when not in standby during office hours.
•⁠ ⁠Perform weekend or after office hours duty though not on standby if required.
•⁠ ⁠Attend to preventive maintenance not limited to hardware inventory.
•⁠ ⁠Follow up on cases from opening till closure.
•⁠ ⁠Update incident tickets properly and promptly.
•⁠ ⁠Obtain certifications required to support key customers.
•⁠ ⁠New assignments by Ops manager or TSM when needed.

Job Requirement:-

•⁠ ⁠Diploma / Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Information Technology related field, or IT equivalent.
•⁠ ⁠Preferably 2 or more years of IT working experience.
•⁠ ⁠Basic Cisco and Alcatel switches/routers/wireless knowledge.
•⁠ ⁠Basic network troubleshooting skills on layer 2 and layer 3.
•⁠ ⁠Basic Network Security Knowledge.
•⁠ ⁠Basic Server Administration Knowledge.
•⁠ ⁠Certification in CCNA or any other network certifications will be a value-add.
•⁠ ⁠Possess initiative and disposition with a strong commitment and orientation towards results and high-quality standards.
•⁠ ⁠Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think outside the box.
•⁠ ⁠Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills.
•⁠ ⁠Self-motivator with a positive attitude and high energy.

Support and maintain organization’s computer systems, desktops, and peripherals.

Generating MIS reports
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.

1 - 2 years of experience in desktop support, maintenance, and basic infrastructure/network troubleshooting.

Job Description:
Job Description
Deep dive into development lines, learning and understanding the mechanism of every application component, and promoting product scalability, stability and performance.
Setup, manage and maintain product, middleware, big-data applications and services.
Perform regular and ad-hoc server-side deployments, performance fine-tuning and troubleshooting.
Design and develop automations for workflows.
Capacity and Resource management.
Responsible for the full-chain stress test to enhance the performance and remove redundancy of applications.
Prepare routine operation documentation.
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related fields.
Minimum 2 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineer roles or equivalent.
Extensive and hands-on knowledge with Linux operating systems (Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.).
Knowledge of Computer Network(TCP/IP, DNS, etc.) and OS.
Hands-on experience with at least one of the programming languages: Bash, Python, Go.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to thrive under difficult and stressful situations.
Passion and high sense of responsibility for work.
Fast learning ability and a good team player.
Detailed-oriented, cautious and prudent.
Skills below are optional but preferable:
Experience with automation tools like Ansible, Jenkins.
Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Zabbix, Grafana etc.
Experience with load balancing tools like LVS, Nginx, Openresty or HAProxy.
Experience with container technology such as Docker, Kubernetes.
Experience with Kafka and Codis

Job Description:
Your new company
Be a part of a world’s leading tech company, engaging with exciting new technologies.

Your new role
We are looking for a Data Engineer who will join the L2 support squad responsible for platform administration, operational support, small change, and release management. The role will be part of a highly qualified team, primarily based in Singapore.

The role will cover the following areas:
· Release Management and Support activity (~60%):
· Assist the team with Production code deployment and data platform support.
· Act as a gatekeeper in Production following client's change management process.
· Support production data pipelines and reports.
· Provide detailed analysis of data issues in Production with a quick turnaround time
· On occasion, provide support for applications in Public Holidays and in weekend releases.
· Work closely with the L2 Squad Lead, prioritizing tasks based on L2 leads’ direction.

What you'll need to succeed
· 3–8 years of relevant experience in a support role, with experience using JIRA or similar tools to track issues and manage them through a small team.
· Develop high-quality data pipelines using Spark, Python, SQL, and Azure services.
· Strong proficiency in writing complex SQL Queries, Stored Procedures etc.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
It’s people who make the Robert Walters experience so special – which makes this a great place to take on the role of Senior Principal. A world-leading specialist professional recruitment consultancy, we are a diverse, global family with a strong sense of community at each of our offices. Our teams are supportive, friendly and full of fascinating people with a positive, future-focused outlook, who share ideas, success and rewards openly. So we offer a fun, vibrant and dynamic culture, the flexibility to manage your workload smartly and the high-performance environment you need to reach your full potential. Get ready to step up to the next level.
About the Role
As a Senior Principal, you’ll be a prominent member of the team. That’s why we’re looking for a high achiever with great track record who can lead by example and get the best out of others. You’ll work closely with our clients, building positive, constructive relationships with them as well as with our candidates by providing world class service. You can also expect to create new opportunities and win new business by networking, attending client meetings, gathering market information and making business development calls. Alongside all of that you’ll send the strongest CVs across to clients and place the right candidates in the right organisations.
In simple terms, you strive to make daydreaming about a job becomes a reality for your candidates by matching them with the right job role.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible in new client acquisition from leads generation to negotiating terms to secure exclusive relationships and retain existing business in order to continuously develop your business area.
Handle a range of clients and take responsibility for key relationships, ensuring we deliver on all client expectations and our SLAs
Manage the recruitment process from beginning to end, including the development and delivery of short and long-term recruitment campaigns
Source, select and match high quality candidates, ensuring only the best are put forward to our clients for interview
Provide guidance to other team members on all aspects of recruitment, mentoring less experienced colleagues
Support your manager in identifying team and individual areas for development, deputising for them in their absence
About you
To join us as a Senior Principal, your skills and experience should include:
Minimum 10 years of prior recruitment experience in a recruitment agency environment is mandatory, specialising in HR recruitment.
The drive to make things happen and hit your targets, even under pressure
Strong negotiation skills and a highly strategic, commercial mindset
Passion to come into a sales and client management environment.
Strong communication and articulation skill
An entrepreneurial, professional approach and a commitment to self-development
The ability to maintain a high profile and to set the standards for the team
Strong problem-solving and lateral-thinking skills – you deliver innovative solutions
Our Culture
We put our people at the heart of everything we do. Building deep, productive relationships, we help high-profile candidates seize amazing career opportunities with the world’s leading businesses. By doing so, we power people and organisations to fulfil their unique potential. We celebrate individual talent, entrepreneurial spirit, genuine teamwork and personal success of our own people every day.
What is in it for you?
Competitive salaries & quarterly bonus
Clear career progression plan based on merits
Collaborative working environment that is sociable, celebratory and supportive
Best in class training & development programmes
What's next:
Ready to elevate your career? Apply now. Submit your application today by clicking on the provided link.
Please note that only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear back within 14 days, please consider your application unsuccessful.
Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
Standard Chartered bank is hiring senior Haskell developers for the front office Modelling and Analytics Group. We have dozens of developers working in very diverse financial market projects within corporate and institutional banking. Some of our projects are user-facing GUIs, others are server-side request handlers or reporting tools. Their scope ranges from small applications to support a single team, to processes that handle millions of trades, or have thousands of users. We use Haskell (or our in-house variant, Mu) for practically everything we do.
We expect solid computer science knowledge and demonstrated typed functional programming experience at all levels, but you will also be responsible for architecture design, stakeholder communication, project management, and project and/or team leadership. We use git for source control and the Atlassian suite (Bitbucket, Confluence, Jira) for code reviews, documentation and project tracking. No finance knowledge is required, but excellent communication and collaboration skills are essential. We believe our unique diversity is a key aspect of our success and strive to maintain an open and inclusive culture to everyone.
After an initial three-month period in-office, this role can be performed flexibly in time and location, but only from the country of payroll.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Software development to generate revenue for the bank
Understand front office concerns in order to bridge the gap between the front office and back office
Risk modelling to quantify the various kinds of risks faced by the Bank
Deliver robust, high performance software and quantitative analyses
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with FM traders and structuring teams, analysing trades and asset origination opportunities for execution and ongoing measurement and management
Maintain and develop cutting edge trading, pricing and multi assets risk management platforms
Work on projects ranging from client-facing GUIs, server-side request handlers or reporting tools, and devops
Use of Haskell and our in-house variant, Mu
Ensure adherence to all internal and external regulations
Support Operational Risk monitoring via reports and data provided to Compliance and BORM
Assist in ensuring that there are appropriate and documented internal controls and procedures in place
Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values.
Contribute to continuous process improvement and sharing best practice
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE
3+ Years of experience in credit analysis gained in banking, credit insurance, or another similar financial services sector.
Haskell programming experience.
Solid computer science knowledge (algorithms, data structures, complexity, concurrency / parallelism)
Software Engineering
Haskell / Mu Development
Technical Project Leadership
Stakeholder Communication
FM Business Domain Knowledge
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Software Engineering
Haskell / Mu Development
Technical Project Leadership
Stakeholder Communication
FM Business Domain Knowledge
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
What we offer
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment Assessments
Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

Job Description:
Responsibilities of the ICT Executive

i.Manage ICT Programmes at the UPTLC/ PD TL
The ICT Executive will project manage Centre-initiated projects and co-ordinate HQ project roll-outs for schools while ensuring that MOE policies, guidelines and standards are adhered to.

He/She will be required to provide project updates to the SH (ICT) and prepare any relevant documentations and guidelines pertaining to the project.

ii.Business Solution and ICT Planning
The ICT Executive will work with the SH (ICT) on gathering the ICT needs of the Centre and propose solutions that meet the requirements of the Centre’s technical specifications and market pricing of these solutions.

iii.Procurement of ICT/AV Equipment & Services
The ICT Executive will assist the SH (ICT) in purchasing ICT/AV Equipment & Services based on the Centre’s requirements (through bulk tenders, calling tenders & quotations)

iv.Manage ICT/AV Resources
The ICT Executive will assist the SH (ICT) in managing the Centre’s ICT/AV resources such as the replacement and condemnation of ICT/AV equipment, and management of inventory and loan of ICT/AV equipment.

v.Work with other ICT Staff
The ICT Executive is required to assign work and oversee the Centre’s Technology Assistant (TA), as well as work with other 3rd party/ in-house ICT Trainers and any other ICT support staff at the Centre.

vi.Other Tasks
The ICT Executive will be required to proactively scan the market for technology trends and new technology tools that support Teaching and Learning, and train and update the Centre staff.
The ICT Executive will be a point of contact with MOE HQ for dissemination and co-ordination of ICT project -matters for schools.
He/she shall raise any issues, concerns and feedback from the Centre on projects initiated by other divisions e.g. ETD so that prompt and effective actions could be taken by ITB to address these concerns and problems early.
He/she needs to facilitate video conference & Webinar sessions through various applications such as MS Teams, Zoom, Google Meet, & Skype.
He/she needs to support and collaborating with Host, Panelist, Trainer’s, assisting to participants for a large-scale meetings, conference, Special Events and Workshops

Job Description:

Our Client is seeking an Enterprise Data Architect who will be responsible for next generation data architecture and blueprints, data platform roadmap and technology stacks. The goal is to transform and standardize data architecture with the recommendation of technology stacks and support the use of data-driven insights to help their business achieve positive outcomes and objectives.

Job Description:
Job Description:
Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders.
Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems.
Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development.
Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients.
Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development.
Responsibilities:
Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements.
Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements.
Proactively research, identify, and specify solutions to problems.
Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.
Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.
Support requirements management and change management processes.
Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.
Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.
Develop and execute acceptance test plans and test cases

Knowledge and Skills
Ability to work effectively in a team
Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain.
Specialized: developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans
Experience is Public Sector implementation is an advantage
