Job Description:
The Data & Machine Learning Engineer plays a hybrid role that focuses on developing a modern Lakehouse platform, building data pipelines, and deploying machine learning models at scale. This position blends the responsibilities of a Data Engineer and Machine Learning Engineer to ensure robust data infrastructure and effective deployment of ML models. The ideal candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams, working closely with Data Analysts, Business Analysts, and DevOps engineers to deliver reliable, scalable, and efficient data and ML solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Build, automate, and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines to ensure smooth data flow and availability across the Lakehouse platform.
Partner with analysts to design scalable data storage solutions optimized for analytics and ML applications.
Ensure data quality by implementing monitoring mechanisms to guarantee consistency, reliability, and compliance.
Continuously monitor ML models, retrain and adjust them as necessary to maintain high performance.
Design and implement CI/CD pipelines for seamless model deployment and ensure reliable delivery of models into production environments.
Provide guidance and mentorship to junior engineers, supporting their growth and enhancing project delivery capabilities.
Skills & Experience:
Strong teamwork skills, able to align data solutions with business needs, and communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.
Expertise in analyzing data-driven insights and translating them into technical solutions.
Proficient in designing and implementing data pipelines using Databricks and Spark.
Advanced skills in SQL and Python for querying, modeling, and transforming data efficiently.
Expertise in deploying machine learning models and creating APIs for serving predictions.
Skilled in processing large-scale datasets and supporting machine learning workflows on Databricks.
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment, testing, and validation of data pipelines and ML models using GitHub and GitHub Actions.
Proven ability to monitor ML model performance, track key metrics, and maintain accuracy.
Experience with automating cloud infrastructure using tools like Terraform for consistent deployment and scaling.
Basic knowledge of Power BI for visualizing model performance and metrics.
Qualifications Required:
5+ Years in Data Engineering: Solid experience building and maintaining data infrastructure, including best practices in data pipeline development.
3+ Years in Machine Learning Engineering: Demonstrated experience managing the lifecycle of ML models from deployment to monitoring and retraining.
Business & Data Transformation: Proven track record in supporting business transformation and process improvements by leveraging data-driven solutions.
Agile Methodologies: Comfortable working in Agile environments with the ability to adapt and respond quickly in fast-paced settings.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
It’s people who make the Robert Walters experience so special – which makes this a great place to take on the role of Senior Principal. A world-leading specialist professional recruitment consultancy, we are a diverse, global family with a strong sense of community at each of our offices. Our teams are supportive, friendly and full of fascinating people with a positive, future-focused outlook, who share ideas, success and rewards openly. So we offer a fun, vibrant and dynamic culture, the flexibility to manage your workload smartly and the high-performance environment you need to reach your full potential. Get ready to step up to the next level.
About the Role
As a Senior Principal, you’ll be a prominent member of the team. That’s why we’re looking for a high achiever with great track record who can lead by example and get the best out of others. You’ll work closely with our clients, building positive, constructive relationships with them as well as with our candidates by providing world class service. You can also expect to create new opportunities and win new business by networking, attending client meetings, gathering market information and making business development calls. Alongside all of that you’ll send the strongest CVs across to clients and place the right candidates in the right organisations.
In simple terms, you strive to make daydreaming about a job becomes a reality for your candidates by matching them with the right job role.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible in new client acquisition from leads generation to negotiating terms to secure exclusive relationships and retain existing business in order to continuously develop your business area.
Handle a range of clients and take responsibility for key relationships, ensuring we deliver on all client expectations and our SLAs
Manage the recruitment process from beginning to end, including the development and delivery of short and long-term recruitment campaigns
Source, select and match high quality candidates, ensuring only the best are put forward to our clients for interview
Provide guidance to other team members on all aspects of recruitment, mentoring less experienced colleagues
Support your manager in identifying team and individual areas for development, deputising for them in their absence
About you
To join us as a Senior Principal, your skills and experience should include:
Minimum 10 years of prior recruitment experience in a recruitment agency environment is mandatory, specialising in HR recruitment.
The drive to make things happen and hit your targets, even under pressure
Strong negotiation skills and a highly strategic, commercial mindset
Passion to come into a sales and client management environment.
Strong communication and articulation skill
An entrepreneurial, professional approach and a commitment to self-development
The ability to maintain a high profile and to set the standards for the team
Strong problem-solving and lateral-thinking skills – you deliver innovative solutions
Our Culture
We put our people at the heart of everything we do. Building deep, productive relationships, we help high-profile candidates seize amazing career opportunities with the world’s leading businesses. By doing so, we power people and organisations to fulfil their unique potential. We celebrate individual talent, entrepreneurial spirit, genuine teamwork and personal success of our own people every day.
What is in it for you?
Competitive salaries & quarterly bonus
Clear career progression plan based on merits
Collaborative working environment that is sociable, celebratory and supportive
Best in class training & development programmes
What's next:
Ready to elevate your career? Apply now. Submit your application today by clicking on the provided link.
Please note that only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear back within 14 days, please consider your application unsuccessful.
Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job Description:
InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years of experience, also named as Gartner’s 2020, 2021 and 2022 customers’ choice for Data & Analytics providers. We continue to grow rapidly year over year, now employing more than 1,200 people in offices across the globe. As we have grown, we have stayed true to our mission—to always help our customers stay modern that help them make smart, data-driven decisions. Since 2004, we have deployed hundreds of high performance analytics applications over web and mobile platforms, built several advanced analytics models, processed petabytes of data using Big Data technologies and delivered several high impact business solutions. Driven by our vision of delivering great customer experiences, we are looking for professionals who are passionate about making the world a better place by leveraging the power of data.
We are hiring aspiring / proven data engineers to join us. We provide extensive training, bootcamps/on-the-job to prepare qualified candidates for an exciting career in Data Analytics in Government and Public Sector.
What is a Data Engineer?
The role of a data engineer can be defined as someone who has the knowledge and skills to design and build systems for collecting, storing and analyzing data at scale.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Work closely with the project team to develop and validate ETL workflow and packages in Informatica / Talend
Drive the maintenance of data engineering pipelines
Implement data engineering pipelines as per business needs and technical specifications provided by stakeholders and work closely with the data engineering team to ETL the required data from source systems into datastore
Develop ETL jobs i.e. workflow packages, auto schedulers, in Informatica PowerCenter as per specifications and requirements
Monitor and ensure ETL jobs are successfully executed and handle troubleshooting of any related technical problems on-site
Skills Required:
1 to 2 years of ETL experience
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL scripting skills
Prior experience with ETL operations using at least one other ETL - Informatica and/or Talend
Knowledge of creating ETL packages and configuring workflows
Knowledge of at least one database tool such as MySQL, MS SQL and/or PostgreSQL
Adept at queries with good communication and stakeholder management skill

The SBA will collaborate closely with stakeholders to ensure optimal solutions are delivered, integrated, and aligned with project governance, standards, and reusable solutions across multiple sites.

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze and structure new requirements with stakeholders.
Lead the creation of functional solutions with business and IT teams.
Define and manage the implementation roadmap with technical support.
Drive use case development for Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Oversee solution design, validation, and approval processes (architecture, IT risk, security, budget).
Ensure project governance and coordinate implementations.
Manage user workshops, risk identification, and issue tracking.
Plan and manage migration strategies and change management activities.

Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written.
Strong ability to interact professionally with diverse teams and stakeholders, including business users, technical teams, and senior management.

Job Description:
The Product Owner, Business Analytics Analyst will manage the end-to-end delivery and operations of data analytics products and solutions. This role serves as both a strategist and a liaison, connecting business objectives with technical requirements to drive the analytics product roadmap. The Product Owner will work closely with stakeholders to gather business needs, translate them into technical specifications, and lead the prioritization of analytics initiatives, ensuring alignment with business goals. They will collaborate with the BI and Analytics team to consult on solutions and work with Data Engineers and Analysts to deliver actionable insights that can be effectively utilized by the business.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain a strategic roadmap for analytics products, ensuring initiatives align with business objectives. Regularly update the roadmap based on stakeholder feedback and changing priorities.
Engage with stakeholders to capture business objectives, translate them into actionable technical requirements, and maintain comprehensive documentation.
Balance impact and feasibility to manage project backlogs. Lead sprint planning with Agile teams, creating user stories, acceptance criteria, and documentation for analytics solutions.
Collaborate with Data Engineers, Analysts, and stakeholders to ensure the delivery of high-quality dashboards, reports, and analytics solutions.
Develop and execute UAT plans, oversee testing phases, and manage change requests to ensure deliverables meet user expectations.
Monitor analytics product adoption and performance, continuously refining solutions to maximize business value and user satisfaction.
Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between technical teams and business stakeholders, fostering a productive, aligned work environment.
Skills and Experience:
Strong ability to work within teams, aligning data solutions with business needs and driving creative problem-solving in fast-paced settings.
Adept at translating data-driven insights and requirements into easily understood concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Expertise in developing and managing product roadmaps, balancing stakeholder needs with project priorities.
Proficient in gathering and translating business needs into clear technical specifications, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Proficiency in wireframe and UX/UI design using tools like Figma, ensuring seamless user experience and functionality.
Advanced use of Jira and Confluence for backlog management, sprint planning, and project documentation.
Proven experience leading Agile teams to deliver iterative, high-impact analytics solutions.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Power BI, enabling effective technical collaboration and comprehensive data solutions development.
Qualifications Required:
5+ Years in Product Management/Business Analysis: Demonstrated success in managing product lifecycles and documenting requirements for analytics products.
Solution Consulting: Experience providing expert advice on analytics and data-driven projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and driving continuous improvement.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven ability to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders to support business transformation and process improvement.
Business & Data Transformation: Experience supporting business transformation efforts toward data-driven organizations and systems.
Agile Mindset: Ability to thrive in fast-paced, Agile environments with strong resilience and adaptability.

Job Description:
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity:
EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
We implement information-driven strategies, data platforms and advanced data analytics solution systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end design, build and implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.
We are looking for a Data Engineer within the DnA team in our Singapore office. This role is offered on a flexible full time basis.
Your key responsibilities:
Apply data mining, data modelling, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract and analyse information from large structured and unstructured datasets
Develop and implement techniques and analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful information using dataoriented programming languages and visualisation software.
Visualise, interpret, and report data findings and may create dynamic data reports as well
Design, develop, and maintain the organization's data architecture, including data pipelines, databases, and data warehouses.
Develop and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently move data from various sources to the data
Implement data quality checks and monitoring processes to identify and resolve data issues in a timely manner.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.
Skills and attributes for success
Experience in ETL, Data Engineering, Scripting.
Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects
Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills and stakeholder management experiences
Experience in business intelligence, data warehousing/platform, and data strategy projects
To qualify for the role, you must have
At least a Bachelor's degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science/Information Technology/Programming & Systems Analysis/Science (Computer Studies)
Minimum total 6 years work experience in at least 1 of these job titles: (1) Chief Data Scientist (2) Data Engineer (3) Data Scientist (4) Head of Data Analytics
Experience in development and maintenance of Data processing pipelines
Experience developing machine learning workflows
Work closely with business analysts to create data components
Application packaging and deployment experience across DEV to PROD environments
Ideally, you’ll also have
Dashboarding experience with Tableau / Power BI
Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry.
An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
EY offers a competitive remuneration package commensurate with your work experience where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements, where this may be needed, guided by our FWA Policy.
Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.

To learn more about careers in EYSG, please visit https://www.ey.com/en_sg/careers or like us on https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore

Job Title: Data & Ai Strategy And Transformation  Director Technology Consulting
Job Description:
We are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services.

The opportunity

With our Data & Analytics team in FSO experiencing rapid growth, now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for talent with a passion for data and the know-how to partner with our to clients to disrupt and transform Financial Services organisations.

We are seeking a skilled Data & AI Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will support the development and deployment of scalable and optimized AI/machine learning (ML) models. The role focuses on working with large volumes of real-time, unstructured data to build AI/ML solutions that transition from theoretical models to practical applications. The Data & AI Engineer will also run performance tests, troubleshoot, and ensure smooth operationalization of these models in a production environment while leading and overseeing project teams towards completion.

Key Responsibilities:
AI/ML Model Development & Optimization: Design, develop, and optimize AI and machine learning models for real-time applications. Build algorithms for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) to manage large volumes of unstructured data.
Model Deployment:Work closely with data scientists to deploy AI/ML solutions from theoretical models to production-ready systems. Collaborate with software engineers to ensure proper integration of models within relevant platforms.
Performance Testing & Debugging:Run experiments to assess the performance of deployed models in real-time environments. Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues that may arise during deployment, ensuring model reliability and scalability.
Collaboration & Cross-functional Work:Collaborate within a multidisciplinary team, applying your expertise in statistics, data science, and programming. Work closely with data engineers, software developers, and other stakeholders to ensure cohesive AI solution delivery.
Technology & Platform Support:Stay up to date with the relevant software platforms and infrastructure necessary for deploying machine learning models. Ensure compatibility and seamless integration with the firm’s technical stack and production systems.
To qualify for the role, you must have
Minimum 10 years’ experience in Financial Services (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level). Preferably a year of consulting experience in any of the Big 4 or consulting firms.
Proficiency in scripting and programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Strong experience in data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes for large, unstructured data sets.
Solid understanding of AI/ML model deployment practices, including cloud-based platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Experience running model performance tests, identifying bugs, and implementing solutions in production environments.
Knowledge in statistics, data science, and machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team setting.
Proficiency in scripting and programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Strong experience in data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes for large, unstructured data sets.
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What we offer
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Apply now.

Job Description:
A leading technology organisation is seeking a Senior AI Engineer (LLM / NLP) with 2-5 years of hands-on experience in NLP solution development, particularly in NLP solution design, development and deployment.
The role involves applying NLP knowledge to develop Gen AI solutions, leveraging on a machine learning framework, not limited to Tensorflow, Py-torch, etc.... Responsibilities include designing, developing, and deploying NLP solutions using cutting-edge techniques and technologies in cloud or on-premises environments. Participating in code reviews, architecture discussions, team meetings, and creating comprehensive documentation is expected. For senior staff positions, providing training and support to team members on software development practices and technologies is required.
Your new role

Your new role as a Senior NLP Engineer (LLM /NLP), you will be responsible for:
Work closely with subject-matter experts to incorporate NLP components into existing systems and applications.
Conduct independent research to refine and enhance product evaluation suites, ensuring accurate measurement of model and product performance.
Engage in various data engineering tasks, including data collection, preprocessing, quality control, and augmentation, to curate high-quality datasets essential for model training.
Assess and compare different NLP techniques and tools to pinpoint the most effective approach for specific tasks.
Execute thorough testing and validation procedures on NLP models to guarantee their resilience and dependability. Responsible from design to deployment of AI, ML, NLP and LLM solutions, knowledge of industry trends
Work with advanced machine learning models, focus on large language models like chatbot/ GPT
Conduct research and development projects within AI that align with our strategic objective
Experience in end-to-end development/deployment of machine learning models in production using PyTorch or Tensorflow, experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure/ Google Cloud
What you'll need to succeed
Degree holder in Computer Science, AI/ Machine Learning or a related field.
2–5 years’ experience in AI/ AML / NLP/ LLM, experience in applying these technologies to commercial projects.
Experience of fine-tuning large language models, coding experience with big data tools including Python/ Java/ R/ Scala, use of TensorFlow, PyTorch and other machine learning Frameworks.
Proficiency in Python and relevant NLP libraries (e.g., NLTK, spaCy, Gensim, LangGraph,LlamaIndex)
Proficiency in relevant GenAI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, Llamafactory)
Knowledgeable with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure cloud)
Proven experience of handling project delivery in a multicultural environment, excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and working with cross-function teams
Experience with specific NLP tasks such as text classification, named entity recognition, sentiment analysis, or question answering.
Knowledge of natural language understanding (NLU) and natural language generation (NLG).
Experience with producing NLP models and addressing real-world challenges.
What you'll get in return
In return, you'll be part of an organisation that values its employees. You will have a structured career growth and plenty of global developmental opportunities.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or email Jessica.Wong@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion on your career. Referrals are welcome.
If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position within Cloud & DevOps, AI & Machine Learning, please contact us as well.

Job Description

Responsibilities

· Lifting supervisors appointed for tower or mobile cranes at the worksites must complete the Lifting Supervisors Safety Course conducted by an accredited training provider.
· To review and advice the lifting plan
· Observe, coordinate and supervise all lifting activities in accordance to the Lifting Plan
· Briefing all lifting team members (i.e., crane operators, riggers and signalmen) on the Lifting Plan, risk control measure and safe lifting procedure before the commencement of any lifting operation
· Ensuring that only registered crane operators, appointed riggers and appointed signalmen participate in any lifting operation involving the use of mobile and tower cranes
· Ensuring that the ground conditions are safe for any lifting operation to be performed by mobile cranes
· Be present during all lifting operations: To take suitable measures when unsafe conditions are reported. Also, to rectify the conditions so that the lifting operation can be conducted safely
· Contribute and execution of risk assessment, job safety analysis, safety procedures / check list, safety records and documentation.
· Daily safety audit on all lifting equipment, gears and devices included. Prior to lifting, check on capacity of lifting equipment, gears, devices, grounds, surrounding, overhead obstructions and weather conditions.

Requirements

· At least 3 years of experience as a Lifting Supervisor.
· Experience and knowledge in heavy lifting.
· Relevant certs: Lifting Supervisors Safety Course and Work-At-Height Certificate, etc.
· Adaptable to fast paced work environment, able to work under pressure, able to finish assigned work on time
· Excellent written and good communicative skills, able to interact with people of all levels and teamwork

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
The role will manage the implementation of OD changes within the business, requiring a careful end to end project management from Org Design, execution and reviewing impacts.
The individual will work in partnership with Senior Business heads/ stakeholders/HRBPs and relevant CoEs in HR in executing the OD activation plan, selection/appointments, managing communications and ensuring no lose ends on the downstream impacts.
This role will have direct interactions with the Business, a first-hand experience in learning the CIB business and seeing impacts being made in CIB through the right OD implementation.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategy
Partner with relevant business leaders to formulate and deliver the OD Implementation Plan, enable a high-performance culture focused on enhancing capability and improving productivity across CIB.
Deliver appropriate and relevant HR advice, ensuring that this is aligned to the overarching business strategy, governance processes and risk appetite.
Identify, prioritise and build organisational capabilities and behaviours to drive the CIB strategy.
Business
Proactively form credible relationships to effectively partner with business leaders and challenge / influence relevant decision-making as appropriate.
Act as a change agent and key enabler to help drive CIB change initiatives with stakeholders and wider teams.
Support projects and deliverables that relate to the CIB people agenda.
Processes
Provide support for the implementation and execution of HR processes, policies and procedures ensuring compliance with local regulations
People & Talent
Support on the talent management agenda for the CIB businesses. This will include the following (not exhaustive)
Succession Planning
Leadership Effectiveness development
Talent Management Programmes and Initiatives
Diversity & Inclusion agenda, including the development of female talent
Risk Management
Understand and help manage the people-related risk profile including operational and reputational risk, to Group Standards
Provide oversight of complex employee relations issues involving senior people, significant litigation, and high profile or broad business issues
Support the effective implementation of the Risk Management framework within the role remit.
Governance
Provide support to deliver the Conduct Plan across the region and relevant businesses.
Provide support on investigation and mitigation plans where there are audit findings or operational risks issues in the region and relevant business
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key Stakeholders
Group Head of HR, CIB
Cluster & Country HR Heads
Global HRBPs
CIB MT members
Our Ideal Candidate
10 + years of experience in Human Resource Consulting and Change Management
Role Specific Technical Competencies
Human Resource Consulting and Change Management
Business Intelligence
Leadership and Talent Management
Effective Communication
Performance Management
Organisational Design
Future Ready Workforce
Human Resource Policies, Strategies
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
What we offer
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.

Job Description:
A leading technology organisation is seeking a Senior AI Engineer AWS/ GCP Cold with 2-4 years of hands-on experience in AI solution development, particularly in AI solution design, development and deployment.

Your new role

Your new role as a Senior AI Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Key Responsibilities:
Write efficient and maintainable code following best practices in software engineering.
Working with DevSecOps tools for deploying and versioning code.
Conduct thorough research and analysis of retrieval techniques, language models, and generative AI methodologies.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data pipeline efficiency and accuracy.
Continuously iterate and refine retrieval augmented generation (RAG) methods and processes based on experimentation, analysis, and feedback. This will include embedding, chunking, loading, and search algorithm setup.
Experiment with different retrieval strategies, including information retrieval, nearest-neighbor searches, or knowledge graph-based retrievals, to augment generative AI models.
Algorithm Optimization - Optimize and fine-tune AI models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data scientists, and software engineers, to understand requirements and deliver AI-driven solutions.
Present findings and insights to stakeholders and contribute to strategic decision-making.
Document AI models, algorithms, and processes thoroughly.
Prepare technical reports and presentations to communicate results and methodologies.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning technologies.
Participate in Agile ceremonies with the team to execute on prioritized projects and features.
Implement automated testing and monitoring techniques to ensure the accuracy and reliability of AI systems.
Education:
Candidates are evaluated case-by-case but appreciate qualifications in quantitative, scientific and technology disciplines such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Physics, and Bioinformatics.
What you'll need to succeed
2-5 years of experience in AI Engineering.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Familiar in building scalable AI Solutions within a modern technology stack which includes cloud services, data pipelines, database, and other necessary tooling.
Familiar with CI/CD and test-driven development
Experience in building Restful APIs for AI models.
Familiar with of machine learning concepts (i.e. neural networks, optimization algorithms, evaluation metrics).
Familiar with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques
Familiarity with prompt engineering techniques, such as instruction design, template-based approaches, rule-based conditioning, or fine-tuning strategies.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Must be analytical, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Preferred:
Experience working in an Agile Methodology.
Additional programing languages such as Node.js / TypeScript, C#, or Java
Demonstrated experience in developing and refining prompts for generative AI models, preferably in creative or text generation domains.
Experience with AWS Cloud.
Experience with building, deploying, and managing docker images.
What you'll get in return
In return, you'll be part of an organisation that values its employees. You will have a structured career growth and plenty of global developmental opportunities.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or email Jessica.Wong@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion on your career. Referrals are welcome.
If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position within Cloud & DevOps, AI & Machine Learning, please contact us as well.

Facilities Manager
Work Dynamics - Integrated Facilities Management

Job Description
Support workplace projects, such as office moves and renovations, ensuring that they are completed on time.

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
This is an individual contributor role responsible for performing independent validation of models used in credit risk management, regulatory capital calculation, loss provisioning, stress testing etc. The role involves working with multiple stakeholders across different businesses and geographies. The incumbent need to be well versed with the credit risk modelling landscape and technical expertise in developing or validating statistical models within banking industry.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Risk Management
Perform an independent validation of new and existing models that are used in credit risk management, capital calculation, loss provisioning, stress testing etc.
Qualitative review of model development process including underlying assumptions & theoretical basis.
Quantitative assessment of model performance via data evaluation and statistical testing.
Documentation of validation findings and communication of results to senior management and presentation to relevant committees.
Coordination with internal stakeholders on model issues, achieving suitable resolutions.
Manage and complete the model validation from end to end, meeting the planned timelines and required standards.
Recommend improvements in the models.
Review regulatory requirements and industry practice regarding the models.
Assist Head of Model Validation in addressing concerns or questions relating to the models.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Key Stakeholders
Retail Risk Analytics
Wealth & Retail Banking
Corporate & Institutional Banking
Country Risk Teams
Group Internal Audit
External Audit
Regulators – HKMA, PRA, FSS, BNM, MAS etc.
Model Risk Management
Group Operational Risk
Our Ideal Candidate
7+ years of experience in analytics, developing or validating statistical models within banking industry.
Knowledge of IRB & IFRS9 regulations for credit risk.
Good understanding and experience in credit risk modelling, and/or stress testing analysis.
Proficient in statistical and data analysis using data management and statistical software which includes SAS, R, Excel etc. Expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms will be added advantage.
Strong communication and project management skills.
Strong focus on quality control and attention to detail.
Knowledge of banking data and IT infrastructure, including data management and data quality control
Effective presentation and business engagement skills at senior executive level.
Role Specific Technical Competencies:
Knowledge in IRB & IFRS9 regulations for credit risk.

About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.
Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
What we offer
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

Job Description:
Your new company
My client is a global real estate investment and property management company with a portfolio focused on the hospitality sector.
To support its growth, the team is looking for a Corporate Development Manager to support business decision-making and corporate planning.

Your new role
The Corporate Development Manager will play a critical role in supporting business stakeholders and managing comprehensive reporting for the board.
This role will involve corporate & business planning, strategic analysis, and reporting, with a focus on optimising financial performance and aligning financial strategies with our business objectives. Here's a snippet of the JD:

Business Planning & Analysis
Coordinate and lead processes, including budgeting, forecasting, and long-term strategic planning.
Develop and maintain financial models to support business decisions and assess the impact of various scenarios.
Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement.
Work with Asset Managers, Corporate Finance and external hotel and property managers
Reporting & Communication
Prepare and present financial reports, analyses, and recommendations to the board and other key stakeholders.
Create and manage comprehensive reporting packages, including monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements
Corporate Planning
Collaborate with senior management to develop and execute strategic plans that drive business growth and profitability.
Evaluate financial performance and provide actionable insights to support decision-making and strategic initiatives.
Stakeholder Support
Partner with various departments to understand their financial needs and provide guidance on financial matters.
Assist in the development of business cases and financial justifications for new initiatives and projects.
Act as a key advisor to business units on financial strategies and planning processes.
What you'll need to succeed
We are looking for an FP&A candidate with a minimum of 6 years experience in a similar function within the Hospitality/Real Estate/Consulting industry.
You should also possess a degree in Business Management/Finance/Accounting and/or equivalent qualifications.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, please apply and send your CV to Luo Qi at LuoQi.Peh@hays.com.sg to advance forward.
If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job Description:
Cyber Security Roles in Singapore
Job Posting by Belle Lim, Section Manager at Hays Singapore
Belle.lim@hays.com.sg

Cloud Security Lead
Cyber Security jobs in Singapore
ACTIVELY HIRING NOW

Hi Everyone,
An established leading technology software company with strong APAC presence is looking for a Cloud Security Lead to join them. This is brand new headcount as part of the business’s expansion plan. This individual will get the autonomy to build from scratch. This position focuses on engineering secure methods of utilizing cloud infrastructure services and software to improve the overall security posture and enhance the security of cloud-based environment.

Your new role
· Lead the development and implementation of cloud security strategies and roadmaps.
· Design and implement secure cloud architectures and solutions.
· Develop and manage IAM strategies and solutions to ensure secure and compliant access to cloud resources.
· Develop, enforce, and monitor cloud security policies and procedures.
· Work closely with DevOps, IT, and development teams to ensure security is integrated into all stages of the software development lifecycle (SSDLC).

What you’ll need to succeed
· At least 5 years of experience in AWS Cloud Security, Security Hub, Guard Duty, Inspector etc
· Hands-on experience with AWS, Kubernetes, and web application security
· Strong understanding of SSDLC and security frameworks.
· Strong understanding of cloud security architectures, frameworks, and best practices.
· In-depth knowledge of security technologies and tools such as IAM, encryption, SIEM, IDS/IPS, and vulnerability management.
· Experience with security compliance and regulatory frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2).
· Experience in IAM, secrets management, encryption technologies, SaaS services hardening, Kubernetes and container security.

What you’ll get in return
· Attractive Career Development / Growth – Leadership Opportunity
· Attractive Remuneration Package

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to Belle.lim@hays.com.sg. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact me for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job Description:

Creative food and beverage professional with a can-do attitude and always keen to elevate and redefine the food and beverage offerings under his or her charge.
Confident and meticulous.
Ability to work independently and in teams.
Excellent time management and organisational skills.

Job Description:
At Anaplan, we are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join a Leader in Connected Planning/EPM space in the world and make your mark on the industry. Based in Singapore, you will take your proven track record of new business sales and Account Management of Global 2000 enterprises across Southeast Asia and sell an incredibly versatile solution that is helping people and companies around the world every day to make better-informed plans and decisions Our sales team is sharing our bold vision with companies around the world and helping them understand the power of Anaplan products. We partner with some of the world’s biggest brands, such as Google, SalesForce, Adobe etc. to unlock their full potential for success and to grow our business.

In this role, you will be a key contributor to Anaplan’s revenue growth in while driving change as a market disruptor. Reporting directly to the RVP (Regional Vice President) and you will work with our Sales Development Reps, Pre-sales Consultants and Customer Success Team to build customer value and drive new business onto the Anaplan platform. You may have up to 30 accounts in a defined geographic territory, mostly ‘greenfield’ accounts with several existing Anaplan customers. This type of territory requires someone to further build our footprint by hunting and winning new logo accounts as well as expanding opportunities within the current Anaplan customer base.

What you’ll be doing:
Engaging with targeted enterprise prospects to identify broken business processes and position Anaplan’s unique ability to solve the problem
Building and defending Anaplan’s business value throughout the selling engagement. Navigating complex prospect environments to align the prospect around the Anaplan solution
Building and maintaining a pipeline of high-quality opportunities
Utilizing Anaplan’s value-based selling methodology and Salesforce.com to manage sales processes and accurately forecast business
Recruiting and leveraging partners and existing customers in your territory to build your Anaplan “franchise”
More about you:
10 years+ successful experience in software sales
Experience selling SaaS to Enterprise level customers.
Experience in Supply Chain solutions space will be an advantage.
Experience selling Large and Complex Deals Values
Excellent Presentation skills.
Excellent Software Product Demonstration Skills
Strong technical aptitude to learn the Anaplan solution quickly
Consultative selling skills
Ability to understand and navigate through complex political environments
Proven ability to meet and exceed a sales quota
BS/BA degree educated (preferred)
Bonus Points:
Experience selling Supply Chain Solutions, EPM ERP or BI software solutions is a "nice to have", but we will certainly consider enterprise software sales experience.

Job Description:
Our Company is working closely with a Prestigious Public Listed organisation in Singapore. Due to our dynamic expansion in projects, we’re looking for an analytical and process-oriented Cyber Security Engineers in a junior operational role, to administrate user access and perform security risk assessments and testing to identify and fix gaps.

Job Description:
Maintenance and operations of Security Solutions
Provide operational security administration including creating and implementing user-defined rules according to requirements;
Make recommendations and oversee the implementation for Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions;
Follow-up on Regulator’s Cybersecurity advisory
Ensure compliance to security standards and recommend security implementations
Conduct testing of security controls to identify and close gaps.
Deploy and perform vulnerability assessment to IT assets and projects
Participate in Internal audit
Support in Vulnerability assessment and tracking
Any other Security related task as assigned
Work closely with managed security provider, vendors, information system owners or representatives and infrastructure technical staffs on security incidents to perform incident handling and provide remedial actions.
Ensure all security solutions are working and they comply with policy and procedures.
Respond and remediate in a timely manner in relation to any service outages, with customer satisfaction as priority.
Troubleshoot and remediate issue when necessary.

Diploma / Bachelor Degree in Information Security/Cyber Security or IT-related discipline /Computer Science or equivalent
At least 3-5 years of relevant experience; (For the Senior guy)

Practical knowledge and hands-on experience in managing network security devices (NextGen Firewalls, IDS, IPS, UTM etc.), windows, Linux, and networking service such as DNS and DHCP and scripting will be an advantage
Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Possess initiative, positive attitude and strong passion in Security
Experience in conducting Security investigation and reporting
Good communication skills and able to work independently;
Able to start work immediately or within a short notice is an advantage

Job Description:
Job Description:
This role will be part of the Infrastructure Team that oversees the day-to-day enterprise network operations of the Firm and Cloud Tenant. He/she is responsible for maintaining and administering the Firm’s corporate on-premises and Cloud networks, and mitigation relating to network security, business continuity planning, crisis management and compliance.
The candidate should possess a passion for data protection, proven information security experience, strong communication and organizational skills, and should be self-motivated and have an eye for details. This is a professional level position that requires strong technical and analytical skills. The position reports to the Infrastructure Manager.
This job description will be subject to periodic review and amendment in accordance with the needs of the Firm.
Key responsibilities:
Responsible for all network related projects which involves planning, designing, procurement, developing, configuring and commissioning networks for regional offices and firm’s multi-cloud network infrastructure.
Provide network configuration and troubleshooting for all network physical devices such as routers, switches, wireless network and load balancers etc. across the regional offices and firm’s multi-Cloud tenant.
Maintain network performance by performing network monitoring and analysis, performance tuning, troubleshooting network problems for all regional offices and firm’s multi-Cloud tenant.
Review, maintain and enforce network security and compliance issues on all network solutions across regional offices and firm’s multi-Cloud tenant.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement network security policies and procedures.
Perform daily health checks to ensure all services met SLA.
Ensure network security and policies conform to the Firm’s audit and risk compliance requirements.
Conduct regular network assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and recommend improvements.
Liaising with network carriers and external vendors to ensure services are met according to the Service Level Agreement.
Perform Capacity planning and network documentation.
Manage and maintain Data Center facilities, cleanliness and security (UPS, FM200, power, cooling and physical access).
Provide level 2 24 x 7 support relating to all network issues.
Keep abreast of new and emerging network technologies. Evaluate and recommend improvements whenever applicable, eg leveraging AI to optimize network operations, minimizing downtime.
Job Requirements:
Possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Computer Engineering, or equivalent
At least 5 years of working experience in the network field.
Candidate should possess CCNA/CCNP and other relevant Network certifications or equivalent.
Hands-on L2/L3 experience in supporting and troubleshooting in network and multi-cloud environment.
Proficient in implementing and managing network devices such as Switches, Routers, Servers, Cables, Racks, Wireless network.
Proficient in implementing and managing network routing protocols/technologies such as EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, IPV6, MPLS, QoS and network security.
Prior experience with multi-cloud networking, computing and security will be an advantage.
Exposure to network equipment (Cisco, Aruba, HP, Fortinet, F5, etc.) will be an added advantage.
Candidate must have a good understanding of ITIL, including Service and Change Management
Possess good analytical and troubleshooting skills in the area of troubleshooting and rectification.
Good verbal, written communications skills, and a self-motivated team player, capable of working with minimal supervision.

Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Avocado Guild is recognized as one of the earliest web3 gaming guilds working closely with blockchain games. The company was first established in 2021 and grew to become the largest web3 gaming guild, providing benefits for communities in SEA via gaming opportunities. Over time we’ve evolved to become a leading web3 gaming incubator, dedicated to building out the sector via strategic investments, game design, community building, and infrastructure development.

Our goal is to empower and educate the public about blockchain technology and opportunities through web3 Gaming. We are venture capital-backed by leading investors such as Animoca Brands, Solana Ventures, and Polygon Ventures just to name a few. The company is well-equipped to navigate and evolve within the sector of Blockchain technology with a focus on gaming.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategic Development: Collaborate with the COO and Head of Engineering to craft and execute sprint plans that drive our business objectives forward.
Documentation and Specification: Take charge of documenting product scopes in Jira, using multimedia tools such as videos and wireframes, alongside comprehensive summaries to ensure clarity of product features for the development team.
Quality Assurance: Oversee the creation of detailed test cases for each user story to facilitate effective QA processes.
Sprint Management: Work closely with the development team to maintain sprint schedules, addressing any roadblocks promptly.
Data-Driven Design: Employ data analytics to strategically design and refine product features, significantly enhancing user engagement and satisfaction.
Continuous Improvement: Spearhead enhancements in our product design, delivery, and QA processes.
Ownership: Manage the complete product delivery cycle, from design through testing to launch, ensuring excellence at every stage.
Market Analysis: Conduct comprehensive market research and competitive analysis to inform product strategy and positioning.
Customer Interaction: Engage directly with customers through interviews and feedback sessions to derive insights that shape product features and strategies.
Roadmap Development: Develop and maintain a clear product roadmap, aligning product milestones with strategic business goals.
Strategic Impact: Contribute to the broader strategic planning of the company, shaping how product initiatives support business growth.
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:
Strategic Experience: Minimum of 5 years in product management, with a proven track record of strategic planning and lifecycle management in the tech or gaming industries.
Agile and QA Proficiency: Expertise in managing agile development sprints and using project management tools such as Jira. Experience in overseeing quality assurance processes and ensuring alignment with product specifications.
Advanced Analytical and Market Research Skills: Demonstrated capability in data analysis and feature optimization through A/B testing. Strong skills in conducting market analysis and competitive research to inform product strategy.
Customer Engagement Expertise: Extensive experience in directly interacting with customers, conducting user research, and integrating feedback to enhance product development.
Technical and Blockchain Proficiency: Proficiency in using advanced product management tools such as Confluence, and ClickUp. Knowledge of blockchain technology, particularly as it applies to gaming, is highly advantageous.
Leadership and Cross-functional Coordination: Highly disciplined and self-driven with proven leadership skills, capable of managing and coordinating cross-functional teams. Experience in developing and maintaining product roadmaps that align with business objectives.
Organizational and Communication Skills: Exceptional organizational and documentation skills, combined with the ability to communicate effectively across teams and with senior management. Demonstrated ability to articulate product visions, decisions, and strategic priorities clearly and persuasively.

Job Title: Tender Specialist & Drafter   Security System Integration
Job Description:
Job Title: Tender Specialist & Drafter (CAD) - Security System Integration
Position: Tender Specialist & Drafter (CAD)

Department: Project Sales Department
Reports to: Sales Manager/Sales Director

Job Summary:
The ideal candidate will study tender specifications and prepare accurate quotations for security system integration projects. Additionally, they will produce detailed design drawings using CAD and BIM software. This role requires both technical drafting skills and an understanding of tender processes to ensure that bids are competitive and meet client requirements.

Key Responsibilities:
Review and analyze tender documents, specifications, and drawings related to security systems (CCTV, access control, intercom, etc.).

Prepare detailed and competitive quotations based on tender specifications and project requirements.
Collaborate with internal teams to gather necessary data, such as material costs, labor estimates, and timelines for quotations.

Ensure that all tender submissions are compliant with client specifications and industry standards.

Produce technical drawings and layouts using CAD and BIM software (AutoCAD, Revit) for project designs.

Maintain and update design documentation and manage drawing revisions.

Assist in the preparation of as-built drawings and design modifications as needed.

Track and manage the submission of tenders, ensuring deadlines are met.


Requirements:
> ITE or Diploma in Engineering, Quantity Surveying, or a related field.
> Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit) and experience with BIM will be an advantage.
> Experience in reviewing tender specifications and preparing cost estimates or quotations.
> Familiarity with security system components (CCTV, access control, intercom) is preferred.
> Strong organizational skills and attention to detail in both quotation preparation and drafting.
> Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks with tight deadlines.
> Excellent communication skills for liaising with clients, engineers, and suppliers.


** This role is ideal for someone who has both technical drafting skills and a good understanding of tender processes, ensuring smooth project preparation and design.

Strong technical project oversight skills with experience managing ICT projects from initiation to completion. Ability to coordinate technical aspects effectively, ensuring alignment with project goals and technical requirements.

Job Description:
Lead and Manage IT Audits:
Plan, organize, and oversee IT audit assignments across various systems and departments.
Ensure audits are aligned with the organization’s overall risk management strategy.
Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with IT governance frameworks and security standards.
Perform Risk Assessments:
Analyze and assess risks related to IT infrastructure, applications, and operational processes.
Evaluate the adequacy of IT controls to safeguard against potential risks, such as data breaches, system failures, and cyber threats.
Prioritize risk areas for audits based on impact, likelihood, and control weaknesses.
Execute IT Audits:
Conduct audits to assess the effectiveness and efficiency of IT security measures and governance practices.
Review system configurations, network security, access control measures, data management protocols, and disaster recovery plans.
Document audit findings, identify gaps, and report on the adequacy and effectiveness of the organization’s IT controls and governance structures.
Recommend Process Improvements:
Develop actionable recommendations to strengthen IT security, improve risk management processes, and enhance governance frameworks.
Work closely with the IT and operations teams to implement suggested improvements and monitor progress.
Advise management on industry best practices to maintain a secure and efficient IT environment.
Compliance and Reporting:
Ensure audits comply with applicable regulatory requirements, industry standards (such as ISO, NIST, etc.), and internal policies.
Prepare detailed audit reports outlining findings, risks, and recommendations.
Present audit outcomes to senior management and provide ongoing support to maintain a secure IT infrastructure.
Requirements:
Degree in IT with 6+ years in IT audit, security, and control.
CISA, CIA, CISSP preferred.
Expertise in IT governance, risk, and audit.
Proficient in multiple IT domains and technologies.
Skilled in evaluating IT security and risk management.
Knowledge of cybersecurity trends.
Strong communication, analytical, and teamwork skills.
2 years contract
5 days work week
Location Depot Road

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior DevOps Engineer to contribute to significant government projects!
Join a team that utilizes technology to enhance the lives of Singaporeans.
Agile development culture to promote continuous learning and growth.
Competitive remuneration package. Hybrid working arrangement.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate software build, test, and deployment processes.
Implement monitoring solutions and manage monitoring and alerting tools.
Providing DevOps architecture implementation and operational support
Maintain configuration management, build, continuous integration, and deployment tools.
Source code management and collaborate with development teams on branching strategies and versioning.
Monitoring automation to effectively detect/predict/prevent issues in the environment and code base.
Streamline operational tasks, monitoring, and infrastructure provisioning.
Design and implement production infrastructure architecture based on application requirements, ensuring scalability, availability, and security.
Integrate security best practices into the software development lifecycle and ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations.
Prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure, fast paced environment.

Job Requirements:
Singaporean only.
Bachelor’s Degree in IT, Computer Science, or related fields.
Knowledge in lots of different open source technologies and configurations.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant DevOps experience, with expertise in automation, containerisation and orchestration .
Prior hands-on experience in handling highly scalable distributed system, configuring automated build, test, and deploy pipelines to streamline the software delivery process.
Proficient in containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Proficient in configuration management systems (Terraform, Packer, Ansible).
Proficient in AWS (Related certification will be advantageous).
Strong scripting skills in Python, Bash, JavaScript and shell scripting.
Working experience in Agile environments or projects (Scrum/Kanban).

Job Description:
The Senior Business Analyst (SBA) will play a key role in leading business analysis for AML/KYC-related compliance initiatives within Wealth Management IT. This role will bridge the gap between business units and technical teams, ensuring the successful delivery of solutions that align with regulatory compliance requirements and business needs.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead business analysis activities for AML/KYC-related compliance projects in Wealth Management.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to gather, document, and validate business and functional requirements.
Organize and facilitate meetings, workshops, and discussions to ensure a clear understanding of project goals and objectives.
Perform gap analysis between different business units/sites and propose solutions to align business processes.
Define and implement business rules, with a focus on AML-specific regulations and standards.
Act as a liaison between business teams and IT development teams, ensuring alignment on project deliverables.
Manage the entire project lifecycle, from design and testing through to implementation and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Lead vendor discussions and coordinate solutions for platform convergence, upgrades, and enhancements.
Handle project escalations, risk management, and ensure all projects adhere to established standards and compliance requirements.
Support project management activities such as cost estimation, project planning, resource allocation, and governance processes.
Skills and Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst in the banking or financial services industry, with a focus on compliance, AML, or KYC.
In-depth understanding of AML/KYC regulations, policies, and financial security measures.
Experience with AML tools for transaction monitoring, alert detection, and reporting (e.g., NetReveal) is a plus.
Proven ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders, including business users, technical teams, and external vendors.
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., JIRA, ServiceNow) and methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to propose innovative solutions to complex business challenges.
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with financial crime or regulatory compliance systems and platforms.
Knowledge of AML transaction monitoring and client onboarding systems.
Strong background in IT compliance or regulatory projects in the Wealth Management sector.
To apply, simply click the "Apply" button or send your updated profile to recruit@percept-solutions.com

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Lead the conceptualization of technical solution architecture based on project requirements and IT strategies. Participate in evaluating and selecting vendors, products, and technologies for the proposed solution.
Collaborate with enterprise architects, subject matter experts, and product vendors to ensure the technical solution aligns with enterprise architecture principles, standards, and guidelines, while fulfilling project objectives. Serve as a liaison between the enterprise architects and the project’s technical delivery team.
Develop and maintain technical documentation for the proposed solution architecture.
Effectively communicate with stakeholders to facilitate the solution architecture process and obtain necessary approvals.
Present and secure buy-in for the technical solution from IT management and the enterprise technology/architecture board.
Conduct research and pursue innovation to stay updated on industry and technology trends.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems, with a minimum of 10 years of experience in the financial industry.
At least 5 years of experience in solution architecture roles, with a strong understanding of the system and project implementation lifecycle within a banking environment.
Experienced in designing scalable, resilient technical architecture solutions, including end-to-end integration across channels, systems, middleware, and data warehouses. Experience with integrating commercial off-the-shelf products and cloud solutions is highly desirable.
Expertise in system integration patterns, enterprise architecture, microservices architecture, and cloud computing services. Knowledge of system and network infrastructure is a plus.
Extensive knowledge of banking technologies and systems, including industry developments and trends. Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD, containerization, and programming languages such as Java and/or .NET.
Functional and operational knowledge in at least one of the following areas:
Payments
Customer onboarding & AML (Preferred)
Digital workflow
Data warehouse & analytics
Relevant certifications, such as TOGAF or cloud solution architect certifications, are highly desirable.

Job Description:
As a software engineer, you’ll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other engineers and product managers in building software to help improve user’ cloud Journey.

Responsibilities:
Design and implement software solutions: This includes writing clean, efficient, and well-documented code based on provided specifications and requirements.
Participate in code reviews: Actively contribute to code quality by reviewing colleagues' work and providing constructive feedback.
Follow software engineering best practices: Adhere to established coding standards, testing procedures, and version control practices.
Contribute to software architecture: Leverage architectural knowledge to propose and discuss design decisions, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and performance.
Provision and manage cloud resources: Utilize cloud provider services (AWS or GCP) to create and configure the necessary infrastructure for applications.
Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Write and maintain IaC using tools like Terraform to automate infrastructure provisioning and management.
Ensure secure and reliable infrastructure: Implement security best practices and monitoring to guarantee application stability and data protection.
Containerization and Orchestration: Deploy and manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes, optimizing for resource utilization and scalability.
Design and implement CI/CD pipelines: Automate the build, test, and deployment processes using GitLab CI/CD or similar tools.
Improve development workflows: Streamline development processes through automation and continuous integration.
Troubleshoot and resolve pipeline issues: Diagnose and fix problems that arise during the CI/CD process.
Requirements:
This is hands-on position, so coding/scripting is a must, especially in Python or Javascript
Developer experience is a requirement
Position will involve designing CI/CD pipelines, and deploying our applications to the cloud. Current technology stack is gitlab, terraform, docker, Python / TypeScript (Vue.js).
Contributing to and maintaining software engineering standards.
Familiar with Git version control (Gitlab)
AWS, GCP certifications would be an added advantage
Other information:
Working Location: One North
Working Hours: Monday - Friday, 9am - 6pm
